tool.name: Delete an Apollo record
tool.command:
@AUTH@
#if str($ask_one) == "yes": #if str($ask_two) == "yes": ## Nope, still don't trust them to not be dumb (or malicious), so we backup first. python '$__tool_directory__/export.py' @ORG_OR_GUESS@ --gff '$gff_out' --fasta_pep '$fasta_pep' --fasta_cds '$fasta_cds' --fasta_cdna '$fasta_cdna' --vcf '$vcf_out' --json '$json_out' '$__user_email__'
&&
## Now we delete python '$__tool_directory__/delete_organism.py' @ORG_OR_GUESS@ '$__user_email__' >> '$output'; #else echo "Nothing to do" > '$output'; #end if #else echo "Nothing to do" > '$output'; #end if

param.name: ask_one
param.label: Are you SURE you want to do this?
param.help: It will PERMANENTLY delete all of the features on this organism.

param.name: ask_two
param.label: Are you really, really SURE you want to do this?
param.help: There's NO coming back from this.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Deletes every single one of the annotations on an organism. Intentionally.
**Why?**
There are legitimate uses for this tool, generally re-opened genomes is a good one. Needing to transfer annotations from one build of an organism to another (with the same refseq name).
@REFERENCES@
